page.title: 14THE PARISH CHURCH-BURGHFIELD
page.content: St. Marys church is on the edge of the village. It has two and a half acres of land including car park. Sometimes it gets full and people have to park in the lane that goes from Reading Road to the church. There is a lych gate which can be used to shelter under when it is raining. Most of the graveyard is grassy except for the gravel path to the church door. There are lots of wild flowers especially daisies and cow parsley. There are lots of trees. Parts of the church are 400 years old. There are about 500 graves in the churchyard a few being over 200 years old. The War Memorial by the lych gate was built after the 1914 - 18 war. The church tower is special because it is the shape of a pepper pot.
